Viewing the Default Groups

When you first create a new server configuration, the User Manager dialog includes a few default groups: All Users, Administrators, System Managers, Security Administrators, and (for StarDisk) Collaboration Users.

The Administrators group initially has all available privileges, unless the system has been set up to ignore privileges. The other default groups initially have no privileges.

  • All Users
    This group must include every user.

  • Administrators
    This group initially contains the Server Administrator user. You may want to add others who have administrative privileges.

  • System Managers
    Users in this initially empty group receive e-mail, at the address specified for them in the User Manager, whenever an error is added to the server log.

  • Security Administrators
    The users in this group can receive e-mail about users who have been locked out or who attempted to log on unsuccessfully. This group initially contains the Server Administrator.

  • Collaboration Users (for StarDisk)
    The users in this initially empty group can access the StarDisk project in a server configuration if that project exists and if the users have been invited to join the project. These users actually access only a subset of the StarDisk project.
